Articles.Content: This was brought once before some years back, but I thought I would revisit it. I thought I could grab the Kraken's eye and bring it back to Kerbin, only to discover that Easter eggs are not movable. They seem to be part of the terrain. I think it would be cool if there were a special class of Easter eggs that one could move around and collect. Maybe something in the lines of a vessel that does not show up on any maps or the control center. Sort of like souvenirs or trophies you can put in your very own Kerbal museum.
There already is this. Well, sort of. 1 in 20 asteroids is a magic boulder. They make cool refueling stations!

This could work quite well if the 'anomalies' showed up on Kerbnet, then at least you could do a meaningful search for them. They could  take the form of special rocks (small shiny asteroids in effect) or odd artifacts that look like they came from other civilisations.

A bit like rescue contracts I suppose,  but they only show up by scanning or stumbling across them.
I support this, in 2061: The Third Odyssey (A Space Odyssey Book) they took the monolith they found on the moon to the United Nations headquarters.
